title: Wanru (Ruby) Liu
text: I am Wanru Liu, a Ph.D. student in Health Services Research at Brown University School of Public Health. My research lies at the intersection of health economics, aging, and health policy, with a particular focus on Medicare, long-term care, and payment reform.

title: Wanru (Ruby) Liu
text: I am Wanru Liu, a Ph.D. student in Health Services Research at Brown University School of Public Health. My research lies at the intersection of health economics, aging, and health policy.

title: Wanru (Ruby) Liu
text:
Brown University, Ph.D. in Health Services Research — Expected May 2028
Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health, M.S. — May 2024
University of Michigan – Ann Arbor, B.S. — May 2022

title: Wanru (Ruby) Liu
text: Research on Medicare plan switching, Chinese health reform, philanthropy, primary care, schizophrenia interventions, and labor market perceptions of women.

title: Research
text: All of my research projects, including health economics, aging, policy reform, and care quality evaluations across the U.S. and China.

title: Switching Between Medicare Advantage and Fee-for-Service After Moving to Assisted Living
text: An analysis of Medicare plan switching patterns among older adults moving into assisted living, with emphasis on dementia care licensing, cognitive impairment, and stability of enrollment using national Medicare datasets.

title: The Impact of the 2017 Health Payment Reform in a Chinese City
text: A controlled interrupted time series evaluating efficiency and safety in Chinese public hospitals under DRG-based pay-for-performance, using SAS to assess hospital performance from 2014–2022.
